intro: Chaerophyllum papuanum, commonly known as the Papuan cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to New Guinea. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
